H0.text: The temperature of the eggs determines the sex of developing crocodilians during incubation.

H1.text: The color of the eggs determines the sex of developing crocodilians during incubation.

H2.text: The size of the eggs determines the sex of developing crocodilians during incubation.

H3.text: The location of the eggs determines the sex of developing crocodilians during incubation.

A4.text: The thermosensitive, or temperature-sensitive, period is the period during development when sex is irreversibly determined. It is used in reference to species with temperature-dependent sex determination, such as crocodilians and turtles.

A5.text: Temperature pulses during the thermosensitive period are often sufficient to determine sex, but after the TSP, sex is unresponsive to temperature and sex reversal is impossible.
